TunableTuple.name: location
TunableTuple.description: The object is placed somewhere on the ground/floor. This executes an FGL search.

Tunable.name: allow_off_lot_placement
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will be allowed to be placed off-lot. If unchecked, we will always attempt to place created objects on the active lot.

Tunable.name: enclosed_room_only
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will run their placement search only for positions that are considered in an enclosed room.

TunableVariant.name: facing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the final location will ensure that the placed object faces a specific location.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The angle that facing will trying to keep inside while test FGL. The larger the number is, the more offset the facing could be, but the chance will be higher to succeed in FGL.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Specify a participant that needs to be faced.

Tunable.name: ignore_bb_footprints
Tunable.description:
Ignores the build buy object footprints when trying to find a position for creating this object. This will allow objects to appear on top of each other.
e.g. Trash cans when tipped over want to place the trash right under them so it looks like the pile came out from the object while it was tipped.

Tunable.name: ignore_sim_positions
Tunable.description: If checked, the FGL search will ignore current Sim positions and any positions Sims are intending to go. If unchecked, these Sim positions will be taken into account when placing the object.

Tunable.name: in_same_room
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will be placed in the same block/room of the initial location. If there is not enough space to put down the object in the same block, the placement will fail.

TunableVariant.name: initial_location
TunableVariant.description: The FGL search initial position is determined by this. If more than one initial position is available, all are considered up to the specified upper bound.

TunableTuple.name: from_joint
TunableTuple.description: The location is based on an object joint.

Tunable.name: joint_name
Tunable.description: The name of the joint to use for the position.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that determines the object to be used for the specified placement strategy.

TunableTuple.name: from_lot
TunableTuple.description: The location is the default lot location.

TunableEnum.name: lot_location_strategy
TunableEnum.description: Strategy for how we will determine a location on the lot. Default: Tries to retrieve the position of the front door, otherwise uses an arbitrary corner (will always be the same corner) Random: Retrieves a random point on the lot

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: The object is determined by a participant on the resolver.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that determines the object to be used for the specified placement strategy.

TunableTuple.name: from_tags
TunableTuple.description: The object is determined by a set of specified tags.

Tunable.name: should_shuffle
Tunable.description: If False, go through each tag in order, and try placement for each object (in the order of their indices in object manager). If True, we gather all objects matching any tag, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

TunableEnum.description: For each tag, in order, gather objects that match that have that tag. If the placement fails, consider another object, then consider objects for the next tag. If should_shuffle is True, gather all objects matching any tag, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

TunableTuple.name: default_offset
TunableTuple.description: The default Vector3 offset from the location target's position.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableVariant.name: x_randomization_range
TunableVariant.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the x axis.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the x axis.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: z_randomization_range
TunableVariant.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the z axis.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the z axis.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: lot_terrain_only
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will run their placement search only for positions that are within the lot and on terrain.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the max water depth allowed.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the min water depth allowed.

Tunable.name: perform_fgl_check
Tunable.description:
If checked (default), FGL will be used to find an unblocked location for the object to be placed after it is created.
If unchecked, FGL will not be performed, and the object will be placed at the location + orientation specified, even if it overlaps other footprints.
Ideally this should be used in conjunction with another system that assures objects will not overlap. This is useful for placing an object on top of a jig, but probably should not be used for placing a build buy object that intersects with another build buy object.
It should also be noted that object collisions will not play nice with save/load, and objects that overlap may be deleted when loading a save. This should be used with objects that are temporary.

Tunable.name: randomize_orientation
Tunable.description: If checked, object will be spawned using a random orientation. Otherwise, it will use the orientation of the target object.

TunableVariant.name: raytest
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will run a raytest to make sure that the object remains within LOS.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Data related to running a raytest to a position.

Tunable.name: raytest_end_height_offset
Tunable.description: The height offset of end point of the ray. 1.5 is the height of a Sim.

Tunable.name: raytest_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the ray. 0.1 is acceptable for a line of sight check.

Tunable.name: raytest_start_height_offset
Tunable.description: The height offset of the start height. 1.5 is the height of a Sim.

TunableVariant.name: starting_position
TunableVariant.description: Use either the previously calculated starting point or perform a raytest in regards to a specific participant.

TunableEnum.name: use_participants_location
TunableEnum.description: A partcipant's location that we will perform the raytest to.

Tunable.name: stay_in_connected_connectivity_group
Tunable.description:
If unchecked then the object will be allowed to be placed in a connectivity group that is currently disconnected from the starting location.
If checked then the placement will fail if there is not a position inside a connected connectivity group from the starting position that can be used for placement.

Tunable.name: stay_outside_placement
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will run their placement search only for positions that are considered outside.

TunableVariant.name: surface_type_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, we will override the routing surface type of the location to whatever is tuned here. Otherwise, we use the routing surface of the initial location.
Example: The initial location may be in a pool but you want the created object to be placed on the ground.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The routing surface we want to force the object to be placed on.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a set of allowed terrain tags. At least one tag must match the terrain under each vertex of the footprint of the supplied object.
